text: {{Infobox writer | image = Shehan Karunatilaka.jpg | name = Shehan Karunatilaka | caption = Karunatilaka in 2020 | pseudonym = | birth_date = | birth_place = Galle, Sri Lanka | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = Writer, Creative Director | nationality = Sri Lankan | period = 2000 - present | genre = Novels | subject = Sri Lankan society | movement = | notableworks = Chinaman (2010) The Seven Moons of Maali Almeida (2022) | influences = | influenced = | website = }} Shehan Karunatilaka (born 1975) is a Sri Lankan writer. His first novel was Chinaman: The Legend of Pradeep Mathew and it won the Commonwealth Prize. His second novel The Seven Moons of Maali Almeida won the 2022 Booker Prize. ==References== Category:1975 births Category:Living people Category:Sri Lankan writers Category:Booker Prize winners
title: Shehan Karunatilaka
